channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very badly damaged road surface over a large area, 11th October
item.description:
Very badly damaged road surface over a large area and in numerous places, making it hard to avoid as you pass through. This is a very busy thoroughfare, the damage has been there for a long time and it's getting worse. Resurfacing needed in the section between Idsall Drive and Southam Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unavoidable pot hole, 11th October
item.description:
The pot hole is directly between the curb and the central island of the pedestrian crossing on Finlay way closest to Hunters Road. It is severe and very close to being unavoidable for drivers
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramble Chase, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights turn red for no reason, 11th October
item.description:
Traffic lights by Nuffield, Barnwood keep turning red for traffic on bypass when there is nothing trying to get out. This causes queues back to C&G roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): C&G Roundabout, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously loose and noisy drain cover, 10th October
item.description:
The drain cover is on the Cirencester Road, opposite Spirax Sarco's HQ and has been in this state for at least a month. It was repaired twice before, most recently only about 3 months ago. Like before, after 2-3 months the tarmac is broken up by constant traffic and chucks of tarmac and concrete get hurled into the air. It needs a different solution; maybe don't have a drain there (as there have since been 2 added just yards away) or maybe a smaller drain cover that does not stick out from the curb so much and therefore will not get as much traffic run over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Land grab. The owners of 17 Farriers Reach own part of the land, but are putting in a driveway, but they do not own all the land., 10th October
item.description:
The owners of part of the land live at 17 Farriers reach but the land is on Stoke Road and is opposite Heron House (post code GL52 7RT). It also next to an electricity sub station. The issue has been reported to Tewkesbury borough council but they don't think they own the land and suggested reporting to Glos Highways. They have cut down trees and are currently excavating the land ready for a driveway
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
